newsitem.title: USA: Ohio joins tobacco industry suits.
newsitem.headline: Ohio joins tobacco industry suits.

text.p: The state of Ohio Thursday became the latest state to sue the tobacco industry to recover public money spent treating smoking-related illnesses.
"Today's action is not only aimed at recovering the millions we've spent treating smoking-related illnesses ..." said Attorny-General Getty Montgomery, who had announced plans for the suit last week.

"The primary focus of this lawsuit is our children, who tobacco companies have shamelessly targeted and who have the most to lose if they buy into the deadly lure of Joe Camel and the Marlboro man," she said.
The suit was filed in Franklin County Common Pleas Court. At least two other states have either announced intention to file suits or were considering such action.
Attorneys general from the states involved in the litigation have been meeting with industry representatives, most recently in Dallas, in a bid to reach a ground-breaking industry-wide settlement.
Ohio said it was the 26th state to actually file suit against the tobacco industry.
